tweet: The 2019 Congressional Art Competition is in full swing. All high school students (9-12th grade) who reside in or attend school in #GA08 are encouraged to participate. The deadline to submit artwork is April 11th. Details can be found in the link below. https://austinscott.house.gov/services/art-competition …

Thanks to everyone that came out to our Mobile Offices this past week. Staff from my Tifton & Warner Robins offices will be in Moultrie, Sylvester, McRae & Fitzgerald next week for additional mobile offices. You can find more info here: https://austinscott.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/rep-austin-scott-announces-spring-mobile-offices-0 …
.@POTUS & @VP, you saw the devastation six months ago. We need your help to provide farmers the assistance you promised them. You haven't forgotten us, have you? (3/3)

.@SenateDems need to stop playing political games. Providing our fellow Americans a helping-hand after devastating natural disasters has been a long-standing tradition in our country, and it has never been denied until now. Rural Americans are Americans, too. (2/3)

Once again, the Senate has delayed a vote for disaster assistance until next week. Since October, farmers & rural communities in GA have been reeling from catastrophic losses due to Hurricane Michael. Rural Americans feel as if they have been forgotten. (1/3)

The Mueller probe has finally come to an end with the Special Counsel concluding there was no collusion. Earlier this week, I had the privilege of honoring Bruce Maynor, Jr., by presenting the Carnegie Medal to his family. On April 30, 2017, Bruce lost his life saving his godson from drowning. This week I reintroduced legislation to bring relief to ag truckers by more clearly defining "agricultural commodity" definition used by FMCSA when enforcing rules & regulations. Currently horticultural & aquaculture products aren't included in definition. https://www.trucker.com/regulations/bill-would-broaden-agricultural-commodity-definition-ag-hauler-hos-exemption …

Impacts have been felt for months & will be felt for years. The delay has made this worse. https://twitter.com/connorobrienNH/status/1105945609746505729 …

Last night, deadly tornadoes ripped through parts of Georgia, Alabama, and Florida. As first responders, law enforcement officials, and utility crews continue to search for the missing and begin cleanup efforts, our prayers are with those impacted by the storms.
